meanings.definition: A type of canoe used in Central and South America.
meanings.sent1: The piragua glided smoothly across the river.
meanings.sent2: We rented a piragua to explore the Amazon River.
meanings.sent3: The piragua seemed to have a mind of its own, steering us towards the waterfall!
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the piragua looked like a graceful swan on the water.
meanings.sent5: The wooden piragua creaked softly as it carried us downstream.

meanings.definition: A Puerto Rican shaved ice dessert.
meanings.sent1: The piragua was a refreshing treat on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: Children ran excitedly to buy colorful piraguas from the street vendor.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled my piragua, creating a sweet, sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The piragua glistened in the sun like a frozen rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of the piragua exploded in my mouth with each bite.

meanings.definition: A type of boat used by indigenous peoples in the Americas.
meanings.sent1: The piragua was crafted skillfully from a single tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The indigenous tribe relied on the piragua for fishing and transportation.
meanings.sent3: A monkey hitched a ride on the piragua, surprising the fishermen.
meanings.sent4: The piragua cut through the water like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the piragua told stories of ancient voyages.
